pros:

competitive pay

review_title: Meal handling and serving to residents who deserve proper care
pros: It is fulfilling work, serving a purpose, collaboration, teamwork.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Chelsea, MI
pros: Easy to apply and get hired as an RN.
cons: Too many rules that don't relate to Nursing practice.

job_title: Facility Maintenance Technician in Chelsea, MI
pros: Great staff and residents. Beautiful grounds
cons: Low pay scale for the scope of work
In some ways felt disconnected from the community

job_title: Resident Care Assistant in Chelsea, MI

review_title: Some awesome staff, but HR passes the buck and covers their butts
pros: Some of the staff are truly kind and caring individuals, the volunteers that come in are also wonderful.
cons: Union workers that make everyones life absolute hell.....only display care for residents when their families visit or the supervisor is around. Complaints about them are handled by changing who is scheduled to work with them.....the rotation is constant because nobody can take it for long. The result: poor care for the patients on that floor because they do not have the chance to have enough time with the new worker to learn their needs and baseline "normal"....because the decent worker cannot put up with the union woman. HR/managers just keep doing this over and over. Try to speak up and risk your neck. One employee tried to speak up and got banned from the grounds! One very loving nurse finally walked right out! This place costs around $10,000 per month.

review_title: Change isn't always for the best
pros: Decent wages are offered and the benefits are great.
cons: The company has a history of high turnover, especially with management positions. This affects the consistency of all other positions since the expectations and policies change with each new management style. I would recommend asking how long the manager has been with the company during your interview as well as the current turnover for the position that you've applied for.

pros: Great benefits. Great pay. Clean establishment. Fun staff. Great location close to home. Residents are very friendly. Other management staff from other departments fabulous.
cons: Boss showing favoritism to other management and kitchen staff. No human resource support to back you. No room for advancement.

pros: The residents were so interesting and I enjoyed making a difference in their lives
cons: Healthcare guidelines in our state only require the minimum amount of workers and not enough to properly care for our senior citizens

review_title: Great place to work and grow.
pros: The residents are a pleasure to work for!  The community is beautiful and well taken care of.  Opportunity for growth within organization.
cons: Staff turn over can be a challenge.  It is hard to create a connection with staff who are changing so frequently.

review_title: Good at state survey time... that’s it
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Chelsea, MI
cons: Management and lack of communication. Rules are different depending on who you are. Management constantly leaving early and not being clear across the board. Makes up rules as they go.
